content.text:
# 2014 British Academy Television Awards

The 60th British Academy Television Awards nominations were announced on 7 April 2014. The awards ceremony sponsored by Arqiva was held on 18 May 2014 at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London.
Winners and nominations
, Best Actress winner]]
, Best Supporting Actor winner]]
, Best Supporting Actress winner]]
, Best Male Comedy Performance winner]]
, Best Entertainment Performance winners]]
, Creator of Best Drama Series winner, Broadchurch]]
, BAFTA Fellowship Award winner]]
, BAFTA Special Award winner]]
Winners are listed first and emboldened.

* 'Sean Harris – Southcliffe as Stephen Morton (Channel 4)'

** Kerrie Hayes – The Mill as Esther Price (Channel 4)
** Maxine Peake – The Village as Grace Middleton (BBC One)

* 'A League of Their Own (Sky One)'
** The Graham Norton Show (BBC One)
** The Revolution Will Be Televised (BBC Three)
** Would I Lie to You? (BBC One)
| valign="top" |
* 'Doctor Who : "The Day of the Doctor" (BBC One)'
** Breaking Bad (AMC/Netflix)
** Broadchurch (ITV)
** Educating Yorkshire (Channel 4)
** Gogglebox (Channel 4)
** The Great British Bake Off (BBC Two)
|-
! style="background:#BDB76B;" | BAFTA Fellowship Award
! style="background:#BDB76B;" | BAFTA Special Award
|-
| valign="top" |
* Julie Walters
| valign="top" |
* Cilla Black
|}
Programmes with multiple nominations
Channel 4 lead the most nominations for any network with 28, 9 ahead of BBC One who had 19. Channel 4's The IT Crowd and Southcliffe as well as ITV's Broadchurch lead the nominations for programming with four nods each.
